snippet: In George Saunders’s latest collection, the stories tend to pivot around loneliness, disappointment, frustration and the difficulty of connecting with other human beings.
abstract: Michiko Kakutani reviews book Tenth of December: Stories by George Saunders.
lead_paragraph: In George Saunders’s latest collection, the stories tend to pivot around loneliness, disappointment, frustration and the difficulty of connecting with other human beings.
